Anthony Law

About me

I'm a 3rd year Computer Science student at the University of Warick and an aspiring software engineer! I strive to create effective and creative solutions with the future in mind. I thrive in a team environment both as a leader and as team member.

Aside from work, I currently volunteer with my church to lead youth sessions in both games and discussion. Most recently, I lead at a christian church camp called PHAT camp where I lead a virtual teen small group.

When I have free time, I like to play piano and guitar. I have achieved Grade 8 piano but since I am only self-taught in guitar I have not taken any grading exams. Whilst I was in secondary school, I played the flute in a military marching band called Corps of Drums.

Aside from music, when I go out I love to take photos and recently have gotten more serious about photography. You can find some of my better photos below in the gallery.

PROJECTS

Bepis Bot

Instead of paying for a licenced reaction role bot for the Warwick Card Games server - a subcommunity within Warwick Esports, I created Bepis bot. There is a designated message that members will add a reaction to, in order to receive a role on the server. The roles then give them permissions to write and read messages within the subcommunities - i.e. if you reacted with a Hearthstone emote, you can then see Hearthstone related messages.

ePortfolio

To showcase just a few of my most recent projects to potential employers such as you, I created this ePortfolio which highlights just some of my technical skills. This website uses a mix of HTML5, CSS3 and ES5. Any JavaScript that is ES6 and above is polyfilled with babel-polyfill. During development of the site, I used a mixture of development libraries such as webpack and other webpack related libraries like html-webpack-plugin. If you have any further questions, please don't hesitate to shoot me an email!

Forkify

As part of a JavaScript Udemy course by Jonas Schmedtmann, I learnt to create a web application that involved the use of APIs and modern JavaScript techniques in ES6. In this course, I learnt about different JavaScript compatabilities with websites and polyfills to convert modern ES6 and above JavaScript, into ES5 which is compatible on more browsers than ES6 and above. I also learnt about CORS and recognised the need of a CORS proxy for API usage for non-profitable and independant projects. As an extension of the project, I implemented a better shopping cart function and improved the portion calculation algorithm and more.
